text: Professor, this all real? Or is it just happening inside my head? Of course it is happening inside your head. Why should that mean that it is not real?
author: Albus Dumbledore and Harry Potter

text: It takes a lot of courage to stand up to enemies, but a lot more to go against friends.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: People ask for what is most harmful to them, and this is their misfortune.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: Nothing is impossible, it is only a matter of whether you have the courage.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: Love (...) leaves its mark. It's not a scar, it's invisible... If you are loved so deeply, even when the person who loves you dies, you still remain under his protection.
author: Sirius Black

text: Always call things by their proper names. Fear of the name only exacerbates the fear of the owner of the name.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: Happiness can be found even in dark times, if you do not forget to turn to the light.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: Do not miss the opportunity to enjoy the good weather.
author: Severus Snape

text: In short, everything was going too well, and therefore quickly ended.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: It is impossible to imitate love.
author: Professor Slaghorn

text: A person is determined not by the qualities inherent in him, but only by his choice.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: Distrust of friends is the height of dishonor.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: There are dark and difficult times ahead. Soon we will all have to choose between what is right and what is easy.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: The people we love never really leave us. There are things beyond death. Pictures... and memories... and love.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: It always sounds better than it really was.
author: Harry Potter

text: If you numb the pain for a while, it will become even more unbearable when you feel it again.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: It is much easier to forgive people for being wrong than for being right.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: We are as strong as we are united and as weak as we are divided.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: Our decisions reveal who we really are, far better than our abilities.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: Even the best of us sometimes have to take our words back.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: Greatness breeds envy, envy breeds malice, malice breeds lies.
author: Voldemort

text: Indifference and neglect often do much more harm than outright dislike.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: The consequences of our actions are always so complex, so diverse, that predicting the future is indeed an incredibly difficult task.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: A force simultaneously more wonderful and more terrible than death, than the human mind, than the forces of nature... the name of this saving force is love.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: The ability to realize in time that you are making a mistake is the property of a genius, but to deny a mistake already made is the primordial privilege of fools.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: The world is not divided into good and bad, each has both a dark and a bright side, the main thing is what you chose - it determines everything.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: Anything is possible if no one has proven that it does not exist.
author: Hermione Granger
